title: How to Get the Link to a Facebook Post on a PC or Mac

steps.title: Go to https://www.facebook.com.
steps.content: Go to https://www.facebook.com . If you see the login screen instead of your News Feed, type your username and password into the blanks and click Log In .

steps.title: Find the post.
steps.content: Find the post. To find it, scroll through your news feed, or use the search function at the top of the page.

steps.title: Click the time stamp on the post.
steps.content: Click the time stamp on the post. This is the text that shows how long ago the post was made. It usually appears beneath the poster’s name. This opens the post.

steps.title: Double-click the address bar.
steps.content: Double-click the address bar. This is the bar that displays the URL (e.g. facebook.com) of the page at the top of your web browser. Double-clicking it will highlight the address. The address that’s currently in the address bar is the link to the post.

steps.title: Right-click the highlighted text.
steps.content: Right-click the highlighted text. If your computer doesn’t have a right mouse button, press Ctrl as you click with the left button. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Click Copy.
steps.content: Click Copy . This saves the URL to your clipboard so you can paste it anywhere.

steps.title: Press Ctrl+V (Windows) or ⌘ Cmd+V (macOS) to paste the link.
steps.content: Press Ctrl + V (Windows) or ⌘ Cmd + V (macOS) to paste the link. You can paste it anywhere, such as in a new post, email message, or on your blog.
